source: P4 Proof Vault - FY2026 Strategy Manual + Demo Enhancement

proofs.title: The Castle - LOD 350 Historic Renovation
proofs.name: The Castle Historic Renovation

twelvePointNarrative.buildingType: Historic Castle (1890s) - Adaptive Reuse to Luxury Condos
twelvePointNarrative.lodLevel: LOD 350 - High Detail for Structural Retrofit
twelvePointNarrative.challenge: Original blueprints from 1892 were incomplete and inaccurate. Multiple unpermitted additions over 130 years created unknown structural conditions. Traditional survey would have taken 3 months.
twelvePointNarrative.solution: Deployed Leica RTC360 with 147 scan positions. Achieved ±3mm variance control throughout. Registered point cloud revealed 14 structural modifications not in any drawings, including a hidden basement room.
twelvePointNarrative.outcome: Architect redesigned retrofit around actual conditions, avoiding $180K in potential change orders. Project timeline saved 6 weeks versus traditional survey approach.
twelvePointNarrative.quote: The scan revealed structural conditions we never would have found until demolition. This saved us from a catastrophic budget overrun.

proofs.snippet: 45,000 sqft historic castle renovation in the Hudson Valley. ±3mm variance control enabled structural retrofit without demolition. Saved $180K in change orders through accurate existing conditions.

proofs.title: CUNY Baruch - LOD 200 Campus Documentation
proofs.name: CUNY Baruch Campus Documentation

twelvePointNarrative.challenge: Facilities team had no reliable as-built documentation. Decades of renovations created floor plan chaos. Needed comprehensive model for 10-year capital planning.
twelvePointNarrative.solution: Coordinated scanning across 4 buildings over 8 weekend sessions to minimize disruption. Processed 2.1 billion points into unified coordinate system.
twelvePointNarrative.outcome: Facilities team now has single source of truth for space planning. Model supports ongoing renovation projects and ADA compliance verification.
twelvePointNarrative.quote: For the first time in 30 years, we know exactly what we have. This model will drive our capital planning for the next decade.

proofs.snippet: 785,000 sqft campus-wide documentation for facilities management. Delivered 17-story vertical building plus 3 adjacent structures in 4 weeks.

proofs.title: Mount Sinai Healthcare Retrofit
proofs.name: Mount Sinai Healthcare Retrofit

twelvePointNarrative.projectName: Mount Sinai Hospital Wing MEP Coordination
twelvePointNarrative.challenge: Live hospital environment required zero disruption to patient care. Ceiling plenum conditions were unknown - original drawings showed generic space. Previous contractor had 47 RFIs from bad as-builts.
twelvePointNarrative.solution: Executed night scanning between 11pm-5am over 14 sessions. Focused on ceiling plenum capture with specialized mounting. Achieved LOD 350 for all MEP elements.
twelvePointNarrative.outcome: Mechanical contractor installed new HVAC routing with zero RFIs. Project completed on schedule despite complex existing conditions.
twelvePointNarrative.quote: Zero RFIs on a healthcare MEP project is unheard of. The scan model paid for itself ten times over.

proofs.snippet: 150,000 sqft hospital wing MEP coordination. Captured complex ceiling plenum conditions for mechanical retrofit. Zero RFIs from scan-derived model.

proofs.title: Mixed-Use Tower - LOD 350 Facade Documentation
proofs.name: Hudson Yards Tower Facade Assessment

twelvePointNarrative.projectName: Hudson Yards Tower - LL11 Facade Assessment
twelvePointNarrative.challenge: NYC Local Law 11 requires facade inspection every 5 years. Traditional rope-access inspection would take 3 months and $400K. Building owner needed faster, safer approach.
twelvePointNarrative.solution: Combined drone photogrammetry (DJI Matrice) with ground-level Leica scanning. Achieved full coverage of all 42 floors from 4 vantage points plus 2 aerial sessions.
twelvePointNarrative.outcome: Delivered comprehensive facade model with 47 defect locations mapped and prioritized. Owner saved $280K versus traditional inspection approach.
twelvePointNarrative.quote: We went from dreading our LL11 cycle to actually understanding our building envelope for the first time.

proofs.snippet: 320,000 sqft mixed-use tower facade assessment. High-detail exterior scanning for LL11 compliance and facade repair planning. Saved $280K vs traditional inspection.

proofs.title: Variance Control Whitepaper
proofs.name: The ±3mm Advantage Whitepaper

twelvePointNarrative.projectName: The ±3mm Advantage: How Variance Control Prevents Change Orders
twelvePointNarrative.challenge: Industry average shows 35% of renovation projects experience major change orders due to inaccurate existing conditions. Most firms don't quantify the cost of bad as-builts.
twelvePointNarrative.solution: Comprehensive analysis of 47 S2P projects showing correlation between scan accuracy and change order reduction. Includes ROI calculator for prospect self-assessment.
twelvePointNarrative.outcome: Educates prospects on the true cost of 'good enough' documentation. Positions S2P as the quality-focused choice. 23% of whitepaper downloads request a meeting.
twelvePointNarrative.quote: This whitepaper changed how I evaluate scan proposals. Now I ask about variance control first.

proofs.snippet: Technical whitepaper: Why ±3mm variance control prevents $50K+ change orders. Includes ROI calculator and case study data.

proofs.title: Industrial Facility - Site Topo + Building
proofs.name: Amazon Fulfillment Center Survey

twelvePointNarrative.timeline: 1 week total (3 days drone, 4 days interior)
twelvePointNarrative.challenge: Tenant improvement project required complete understanding of 40-foot clear heights and 15-acre site for new racking and loading dock expansion. Site had no accurate survey.
twelvePointNarrative.solution: Combined DJI Matrice 300 aerial survey with Leica RTC360 interior scanning. Processed into unified coordinate system with NAD83 georeferencing.
twelvePointNarrative.outcome: Racking contractor maximized clear height utilization. Site engineer designed dock expansion with precise grade data. Project approved 2 weeks ahead of schedule.
twelvePointNarrative.quote: The combined aerial and interior approach gave us everything in one week. Our previous surveyor quoted 6 weeks.

proofs.snippet: 250,000 sqft industrial complex with 15-acre site survey. Combined aerial drone capture with interior scanning for complete property documentation.
